definition: sun/CL:個|个[ge4]/abbr. for 太陽穴|太阳穴[tai4 yang2 xue2]
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
temple (on the sides of human head)
lit. the sun rises in the west (idiom)/fig. hell freezes over/pigs can fly
pinyin: tai4 yang2 cong2 xi1 bian1 chu1 lai2
Tai4 yang2 Wei1 xi4 tong3 gong1 si1

definition: (bird species of China) fork-tailed sunbird (Aethopyga christinae)

sentences.english: In this paper, we propose a mathematical model of planar reflector on the Solar pond.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了太陽池反射板的數學模型，並進行了計算。

sentences.english: Thy Lord knows best, and He has the clouds and the sun at His disposal. --Selected.
sentences.chinese: 你的主無所不知，雲和太陽，都受他的使喚與調節。
宏正自動科技是埃及爲太陽。

sentences.english: There are new spin-off products aimed at older girls and women, such as sun screen and cosmetics.
sentences.chinese: 該集團還推出了太陽鏡和化妝品等新的副產品。

sentences.english: One relatively harmless alternative to sun tanning is to use self-tanning lotions.
sentences.chinese: 相對無害的替代辦法之一是利用太陽鞣自我鞣洗劑。

sentences.english: Electrophoretic coating process on the aluminium alloy support used for solar energy heat unit is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了太陽能熱水器鋁合金托架的電泳塗漆工藝。

sentences.english: 2354 – An accident in one of the artificial Sun leads to drought.
sentences.chinese: 2354年，人造太陽出現事故，導致乾旱。

sentences.english: The sun is a huge blazing ball, a million times larger than the earth.
sentences.chinese: 太陽是個龐大的熾燃火球，比地球大一百多萬倍。

sentences.english: How time fast! The sun set. It is time to come back.
sentences.chinese: 時間過得真快呀，太陽下山了，我們也該回去了。

sentences.english: In combination with the above, solar evacuated tubes provide for the domestic hot water needs.
sentences.chinese: 結合上述，採用太陽能真空集熱管爲家裏提供熱水。

sentences.english: Molly was miserable after she got a bad sunburn on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉在海灘被太陽曬傷後就很慘。

sentences.english: The shower is over and the sun is breaking through the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 陣雨已過，太陽已從雲縫中照射出來了。

sentences.english: The white felt yurts of the Mongolian people stand out in the sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 在太陽下，那點點水泡似的蒙古包，閃爍着白光。

sentences.english: The earth and the sun are two great sources of life.
sentences.chinese: 地球與太陽是生命的兩大源泉。

sentences.english: The strong sun shines above thee.
sentences.chinese: 耀目的太陽留在你的頭上。

sentences.english: Butterfly shapes accentuate the sweetness of heart-shaped faces.
sentences.chinese: 蝶形的太陽鏡會凸顯處心形臉的甜美。

definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
